short_bio: Chef Maria is a renowned expert in traditional Spanish cuisine.

recipes.name: Hilsa Curry
recipes.cooking_method: The Hilsa fish is cut into pieces and marinated with spices. Onion, ginger, and garlic are fried until golden brown, and then tomato and green chili are added to make a thick gravy. The fish pieces are then added to the gravy and cooked until done. The Hilsa curry is typically served hot with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Smoked Hilsa
recipes.cooking_method: The Hilsa fish is cleaned and marinated with salt, turmeric powder, coriander powder, and red chili powder. It is then smoked over a low flame using mustard oil, which gives it a distinct smoky flavor. The smoked Hilsa is typically served as a side dish with steamed rice or as a snack with tea or beer.

recipes.name: Hilsa Bhapa
recipes.cooking_method: The Hilsa fish is marinated with mustard paste, green chili, salt, turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, and mustard oil. It is then placed in a banana leaf along with coconut milk and sealed tightly. The fish is then steamed until cooked. The Hilsa Bhapa is typically served hot with steamed rice and is a popular dish during special occasions.

recipes.name: Hilsa Paturi
recipes.cooking_method: The Hilsa fish is marinated with mustard paste, green chili, salt, turmeric powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, and mustard oil. It is then wrapped in a banana leaf along with grated coconut and sealed tightly. The fish is then steamed until cooked. The Hilsa Paturi is typically served hot with steamed rice and is a popular dish during festivals and special occasions.

recipes.name: Hilsa Fry
recipes.cooking_method: The Hilsa fish is cleaned andmarinated with turmeric powder, salt, lemon juice, ginger paste, and garlic paste. It is then coated with a mixture of red chili powder, coriander powder, and cumin powder. The fish is then shallow-fried in hot oil until golden brown and crispy. The Hilsa Fry is typically served as a side dish with steamed rice and is a popular dish in coastal areas.

short_bio: Chef Hiroki is a master of Japanese fusion cuisine, blending traditional techniques with modern flavors.

recipes.name: California Roll
recipes.cooking_method: To make California Roll, start by preparing the sushi rice and cutting the avocado and cucumber into thin slices. Lay out a sheet of nori on a bamboo mat and spread a layer of sushi rice on top. Flip the nori over so that the rice is on the bottom, and add a line of imitation crab meat, avocado, and cucumber. Roll the sushi tightly using the bamboo mat and cut into slices. Serve with wasabi, soy sauce, and pickled ginger on the side.

recipes.name: Biryani
recipes.cooking_method: To make Biryani, start by marinating the chicken or lamb in a blend of yogurt and spices. The spices used include coriander powder, cumin powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, bay leaf, cinnamon, and cloves. The meat is then cooked with onions, garlic, ginger, and green chilies until tender. Basmati rice is cooked separately and then layered with the meat mixture. The dish is then cooked on low heat until the flavors are infused. Biryani is typically served with raita and salad.

recipes.name: Tandoori Chicken
recipes.cooking_method: To make Tandoori Chicken, start by marinating the chicken in a blend of yogurt and spices. The spices used include garam masala, turmeric powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, paprika, cayenne pepper, and salt. The chicken is then cooked in a tandoor oven until charred and cooked through. Tandoori Chicken is typically served with naan bread and a side salad.

recipes.name: Samosa
recipes.cooking_method: To make Samosas, start by preparing the pastry dough and the filling. The filling is made with potatoes and peas that are cooked with onions, garlic, and ginger along with a blend of spices, including coriander powder, cumin powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, and red chili powder. Once the filling is ready, the pastry dough is rolled out into thin circles and filled with the potato-pea mixture. The samosas are then deep-fried until golden brown and crispy. They are typically served with chutney or a spicy dipping sauce.

short_bio: Chef Carla is a Mexican cuisine expert, blending traditional and modern techniques to create flavorful dishes.

recipes.name: Dhaka-style mutton curry
recipes.cooking_method: Dhaka-style mutton curry is a spicy and flavorful dish that is made by marinating mutton in yogurt and a variety of spices such as chili powder, turmeric powder, cumin powder, and coriander powder. The marinated meat is then cooked with onions, garlic, and ginger in a blend of oil and spices such as garam masala, resulting in a delicious and tender mutton curry.

recipes.name: Mutton Kacchi Biryani
recipes.cooking_method: Mutton Kacchi Biryani is a traditional Bangladeshi dish that is made by layering marinated mutton and basmati rice in a sealed pot and cooking it slowly over low heat. The marinated mutton is cooked with a blend of yogurt and spices such as chili powder, turmeric powder, cumin powder, and coriander powder. The rice is flavored with saffron, bay leaves, cinnamon, cardamom, cloves, nutmeg, and mace, resulting in a delicious and aromatic biryani.

recipes.name: Mutton Rezala
recipes.cooking_method: Mutton Rezala is a creamy and aromatic dish that is made by cooking mutton with a variety of spices such as cumin powder, coriander powder, and garam masala. The meat is cooked with onions, garlic, ginger, and green chili in a blend of oil and yogurt, resulting in a delicious and tender mutton dish. The dish is typically served with naan or rice and garnished with fresh coriander leaves and fried onions.

short_bio: Chef Giovanni is a master of Italian cuisine, specializing in regional dishes from all over Italy.

recipes.name: Rasgulla
recipes.cooking_method: To make Rasgulla, start by boiling the milk and then curdling it using lemon juice. The curdled milk is then strained, and the cheese is washed under running water to remove any residual lemon flavor. The cheese is then kneaded until it is smooth and then rolled into small balls. These balls are then boiled in a sugar syrup until they are soft and spongy. The Rasgullas are then soaked in a rose water syrup and chilled before serving. They are a popular dessert in Bangladesh and India.

recipes.name: Beef Bhuna
recipes.cooking_method: To make Beef Bhuna, start by cooking the beef in a pan until it is browned. The beef is then removed from the pan, and onions, garlic, and ginger are added and sautéed until golden brown. Tomatoes and green chilies are then added along with a blend of spices, including coriander powder, cumin powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, bay leaf, and salt. The beef is then added back to the pan, and the dish is cooked until the meat is tender and the flavors have melded together. Beef Bhuna is typically served with rice or naan bread.

recipes.name: Hilsa Biryani
recipes.cooking_method: The Hilsa fish is cut into pieces and marinated with spices. Basmati rice is cooked separately and then layered with the fish pieces and fried onion, ginger, and garlic. Yogurt, tomato, green chili, coriander powder, cumin powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, garam masala, bay leaf, cinnamon, and cloves are added to the rice and fish layers. The dish is then cooked on low heat until the flavors are infused. The Hilsa Biryani is typically served hot with raita and salad and is a popular dish during special occasions and festivals.

short_bio: Chef Sara is a dessert specialist, with a passion for creating sweet treats that look as good as they taste.

recipes.name: Fuchka
recipes.cooking_method: Fuchka is a popular street food in Bangladesh that consists of small, crispy shells made from semolina and all-purpose flour. The shells are filled with a mixture of boiled potatoes and chickpeas, and then topped with tamarind chutney and a blend of spices, such as cumin and chili powder. Fuchka is typically eaten as a snack or appetizer.

recipes.name: Chotpoti
recipes.cooking_method: Chotpoti is a popular Bangladeshi street food that is similar to Fuchka, but is served in a bowl rather than as a stuffed shell. The dish consists of boiled yellow peas and potatoes that are mixed with tamarind pulp, spices, and chopped onions. It is typically served with a crispy snack called chanachur on top.

recipes.name: Haleem
recipes.cooking_method: Haleem is a hearty stew that is made with slow-cooked lamb, lentils, and barley. The dish is flavored with a blend of spices, such as cumin, coriander, and cinnamon, and is often served with a dollop of yogurt and fried onions on top. Haleem is a popular dish during the Muslim holy month of Ramadan, and is also served at weddings and other special occasions.

short_bio: Chef Toshiro is a Japanese cuisine expert, specializing in sushi, sashimi, and other traditional dishes.

recipes.name: Chicken Kacchi Biryani
recipes.cooking_method: Chicken Kacchi Biryani is a popular dish in Bangladesh made with marinated chicken, basmati rice, ghee, yogurt, and a blend of spices such as cumin, coriander, and cinnamon. The dish is then layered with sliced potatoes and cooked in a sealed pot over low heat, allowing the flavors to meld together. The resulting biryani is a fragrant and flavorful dish that is often served at weddings and other special occasions.

recipes.name: Beef Kacchi Biryani
recipes.cooking_method: Beef Kacchi Biryani is a variation of the chicken kacchi biryani, but with marinated beef as the protein instead. The beef is cooked with the same blend of spices as the chicken, and then layered with basmati rice and sliced potatoes in a sealed pot. The dish is cooked slowly over low heat, allowing the flavors to meld together and create a delicious and hearty biryani.

recipes.name: Mutton Kacchi Biryani
recipes.cooking_method: Mutton Kacchi Biryani is another popular variation of the kacchi biryani, made with marinated mutton instead of chicken or beef. The mutton is cooked with a blend of spices and yogurt, and then layered with basmati rice and sliced potatoes in a sealed pot. The biryani is cooked slowly over low heat, allowing the flavors to meld together and create a rich and flavorful dish.

recipes.name: Shrimp Biryani
recipes.cooking_method: Shrimp Biryani is a delicious and flavorful dish that is made with succulent shrimp, basmati rice, ghee, yogurt, and a blend of spices such as cumin, coriander, and cinnamon. The dish is then layered with mint leaves and cooked in a sealed pot over low heat, allowing the flavors to meld together. The resulting biryani is a fragrant and delicious dish that is perfect for special occasions.

recipes.name: Vegetable Biryani
recipes.cooking_method: Vegetable Biryani is a flavorful and hearty dish that is made with a mix of fresh vegetables, basmati riceand a blend of spices such as cumin, coriander, and cinnamon. The vegetables are cooked with yogurt and a variety of spices, and then layered with basmati rice and cashews in a sealed pot. The dish is cooked slowly over low heat, allowing the flavors to meld together and create a delicious and satisfying vegetarian biryani.

recipes.name: Egg Biryani
recipes.cooking_method: Egg Biryani is a flavorful and filling dish that is made with boiled eggs, basmati rice, ghee, yogurt, and a blend of spices such as cumin, coriander, and cinnamon. The dish is layered with fried onions and cooked in a sealed pot over low heat, allowing the flavors to meld together. The resulting biryani is a delicious and easy-to-make dish that is perfect for a quick weeknight meal.
